properties.areaDesc: Eastland; Montague; Palo Pinto; Jack; Stephens; Young
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 5 at 5:31AM CST until February 5 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
properties.description:
* WHAT...Freezing rain with heavy sleet and snow is expected.
Additional sleet and snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and
ice accumulations of up to two tenth of an inch.

* WHERE...Locations north of I-20 and west of a line from Mineral
Wells to Jacksboro to Nocona.

* WHEN...Until 6 PM CST Wednesday. The heaviest precipitation will
fall through 10 AM with additional light wintry precip through
the afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Hazardous conditions
are expected to impact the morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Poor travel conditions could continue into
Wednesday evening or even Thursday morning since temperatures
will remain near or below freezing. Refreezing of any uncleared
roadways would allow icy roads to continue.
properties.instruction:
Roads, bridges, and overpasses in the warning area will be very
hazardous, and possibly impassible. Travel is discouraged unless
it is an emergency. Keep an extra blanket, flashlight, food, and
water in your vehicle in case you become stranded.

The latest road conditions for Texas can be found at
drivetexas.org.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING
